SEARCH

Class Perceptron1L<T>

java.lang.Object
Perceptron1L<T>
Type Parameters:
T - - Type of data (usually String)
All Implemented Interfaces:
Perceptron<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpamChecking
public abstract class Perceptron1L<T> extends Object implements Perceptron<T>
Implements Perceptron for creating a Naive Bayes model that allows for the addition of and removal of probabilities, useful for finding Naive-Bayes ratios and reporting success/fails of Naive-Bayes classifier trials. Gets extended by SpamChecking.

    • Perceptron1L

      public Perceptron1L(String successName, String failName)
      this.rep= new HashMap<>(),
      (this.succeedTotal, this.failTotal) = 0,
      this.success = successName,
      this.fail = failName
      Parameters:
      successName - - the name for a 'succeed' classification
      failName - - the name for a 'fail' classification

    • Perceptron1L

      public Perceptron1L(String successName, String failName, Perceptron1L<T> loader)
      this.rep = new HashMap<>(),
      (this.succeedTotal, this.failTotal) = (loader.succeedTotal, loader.failTotal),
      this.success = successName,
      this.fail = failName
      Parameters:
      successName - - the name for a 'succeed' classification
      failName - - the name for a 'fail' classification
      loader - - another Perceptron1L to load from

    • success

      public boolean success(T[] arr, boolean success)
      Uses ratio(arr) to tell if it is a success.
      this.rep is UPDATED based on success
      Parameters:
      arr - - an array of items to test
      success - - the true classification
      Returns:
      true if ratio(arr) > 1, else false

    • updateTotal

      @Deprecated public void updateTotal()
      Deprecated.
      Must be used to update the this.successTotal and this.failTotal if calls to addProb() were made.

    • ratio

      public double ratio(T[] arr, boolean success)
      Overloaded version of ratio(T[] arr) with 'as-it-goes' training.
      Updates this.rep based on success
      Parameters:
      arr - - the array of items to find the total success ratio with
      success - - the true classifiction of arr
      Returns:
      total ratio of success to fail

    • addProb

      public void addProb(T name, int count1, int count2)
      Takes an element with fails and successes and adds it to this.rep's corresponding k/v pair.
      Parameters:
      name - - name of the element
      count1 - - number of successes
      count2 - - number of fails

    • getItemRatio

      public double getItemRatio(T name)
      Outputs the success fail ratio of name
      Parameters:
      name - - name of the element
      Returns:
      (name.successes)/(name.fails)
 if #this.contains(name),
 else (1.0)

    • getRep

      public Map<T,int[]> getRep()
      Returns the complete dataset representation.
      Ensures each key is type "T" and is paired
      with an int[2] where the int[0] is number of successes
      and int[1] is number of failures.
      Returns:
      a copy of the representation
